item.description:
Different people are called to photograph for different reasons. This discussion will ask questions around vision and intention. Why are you photographing? What are you trying to show others through your work?

Cynthia and Ken will each show samples of their photography and talk about what it means to them, and why they do this work. This will be an interactive session with the audience. The purpose of this workshop is to focus more on philosophy/vision/intention as opposed to technical details.

 

Location info:

Using the Main Street North entrance (near Poppers restaurant) at the Newmarket Mills, proceed upstairs to conference room suite 313.  Parking options: along the street, in the Mill parking lot directly across the street from the North Main entrance, or the municipal parking lot a little further up the hill (just off Main Street).

Handicap parking is available in back of the building (between the two gray stone buildings).  Enter through #55 Main entrance (Bloomin Cow & Creek Hill Upholstery signs nearby).  There is an elevator located down the hall and to the right.  Take the lift to the third floor, head left and the conference room is located on the left, just beyond the kitchen area.
item.how_to_find_us: Come in through the main entrance and look for Room 313 Conference Room on the third floor.
item.name: Art Talk: Photographer's Vision & Intention by Cynthia Tokos & Ken Kartes
